before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"e2s9k","text":"Take all the reagencies out of a freezer and let them temperate to room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8cmds","text":"The protocol is dedicated to evaluation of 18S rRNA fungal gene copy number using Droplet Digital PCR technology (ddPCR) from Bio-Rad company. This is the up-to-date modification and improvement of clasical probe based qPCR assay. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":82,"length":38}],"data":{}},{"key":"85pcq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1u68","text":"For the assay, we are using universal fungal 18S rRNA primers and a probe that showed broad-coverage and favourable quantitative parameters (adapted from Liu et al., 2012):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":154,"length":16}],"data":{}},{"key":"31qh","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rrv3","text":"FungiQuantF          5'- GGR AAA CTC ACC AGG TCC AG -3' , targets S. cerevisiae 1199-1218,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":66,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nq4c","text":"FungiQuantPrb*    5'- TGG TGC ATG GCC GTT -3',  targets S. cerevisiae 1269-1283,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":56,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ft92","text":"FungiQuantR          5'- GSW CTA TCC CCA KCA CGA -3', targets S. cerevisiae 1532-1549.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":62,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjirv","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djbj6","text":"* Probe must be dual-labelled either with 5’-6-FAM, 3’-BHQ1 or any other valid combination. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q0g0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"noe6","text":"The expected amplicon length is 351bp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3kmsd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"910mr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aimmv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"FC9D0D1D8AE111EAAF890A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://www.bio-rad.com/en-cz/applications-technologies/droplet-digital-pcr-ddpcr-technology?ID=MDV31M4VY"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D26A5A7DFB1149278D9AC1B1FF17CE4A","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3565980/"}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3o9dl","text":"Even thoughthe assay is very robust and can theoretically match 1,057 fungi genera and 2,465 fungal species evaluated by in silico testing, one has to keep in mind that some exceptions persist. For example, the Mucoromycotina, Chytridiomycota, and Kickxellomycotina genera have only partial sequence matches, and Microsporidia, together with Entomophthoromycotina subphyla, do not possess any perfect matches to FungiQuant.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

groups.title: SoWa RI Anaerobic and Molecular Microbiology (public)

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"cbn4h","text":"The crucial steps that can influence the final assay results a lot are precise pipetting, mixing and dilutions!","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":71,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ibca","text":"Keep in mind that ddPCR technigue do not posses as wide dynamic concentration range as qPCR does. You can easily \"overload\" the reaction with too much template DNA putting in. In that case you will see only positive droplets at the end and no negative and system will not be able to calculate copy number for them. As a consequence, you usually have to dilute your template DNA more than for qPCR experiments. Ideally fit inside the range of 101 - 104 coppies of target gene. That is why we usually test several dilutions of few samples in advance to see \"where we are\".","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":444,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":450,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2m762","text":"One have to also keep in mind that using ddPCR technology you must work within the format of eight. If you do not fulfil all the wells in a cartridge you still have to put the reagencies inside the empty wells as well. So, think economically before you start.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40nl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cee3d","text":"Choose a position of samples on touch screen and start dropplets generation. {"blocks":[{"key":"4s6gu","text":"Set up the QuntaSoft experiment as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eim3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4racb","text":"Exp. type:        Absolute quantification (ABS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43mud","text":"Supermix:       ddPCR Supermix for Probe","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23j1i","text":"Target1:          Ch1 (for FAM labeled probes)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fh91l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ra6h","text":"Define the position of ech sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eqh52","text":"Check the levels of reader Oil and waste - green control (bottles are physically accessible from machines left side). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"auf3l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kckn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"19nnb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5ac9r","text":"If the instrument was not in use longer than week it has to be Primed first (oil flushed).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hs8h","text":"Start measurement.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"drlnp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"856kq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7tlr1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f7rsk","text":"After it finishes go over the results and see how many droplets were executed for each sample. To get reliable results total droplet count should be above 12.000. We usually have got 18.000 - 20.000 droplets analyzed per sample.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"sbwyi","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":null,"inlineStyleRanges":null,"key":"vomfs","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f1993","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"E3B0C92E344811EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":236,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"dsm6r\",\"text\":\"An example of total droplet counts, including positives and negatives together, for several environmental samples.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/public/1699dc345bd1e79cfd8cb53f5b62703b3208b8c6ce5a9fb99440ba631b9884a4/b9wui2aw.png","source":"https://content.protocols.io/public/1699dc345bd1e79cfd8cb53f5b62703b3208b8c6ce5a9fb99440ba631b9884a4/b9wti2aw.png","type":1,"width":550},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"image"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f5e0","text":"Set up the treshold just above negative control sample in order to distinguish positive (containing PCR products) from negative (do not contain any PCR product) droplets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djlve","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btm75","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6r8hw","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ccrrl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6bhdd","text":"Quanta software will automaticaly calculate copy number of target gene for each sample by Poisson distribution algorithm. For that calculations at least some of the negative droplets are necessary. If the sample contains only positive population it can not be evaluated. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E3B2464C344811EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":309,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"c16oq\",\"text\":\"An example of 18S Fungi copy numbers data analysis. Last two samples on the left graph are negative (NTC) samples by which a treshold was set up. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/public/1699dc345bd1e79cfd8cb53f5b62703b3208b8c6ce5a9fb99440ba631b9884a4/b9wwi2aw.png","source":"https://content.protocols.io/public/1699dc345bd1e79cfd8cb53f5b62703b3208b8c6ce5a9fb99440ba631b9884a4/b9wvi2aw.png","type":1,"width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4e0sh","text":"Export .csv file with concentrations (copies/ul) that are posessing you number of copies in 1ul of reaction. To obtain number of copies in 1ul of your input DNA you have to recalculate:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hp8c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3si1d","text":"no. of copies in 1ul of input DNA = (concentration value x 22)/ volume of DNA ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
